alert.note: Alert for Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 8:43PM CDT until April 19 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Near Monticello affecting Lawrence County. Pearl River Near Rockport affecting Copiah and Simpson Counties. Pearl River Near Columbia affecting Marion County. For the Lower Pearl River ...including D`lo, Rockport, Monticello, Columbia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Columbia. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low areas near the river begin to flood. Water covers Old Highway 35 on the west side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 17.5 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Pearl River Columbia 17.0 15.5 Fri 7 pm CDT 16.8 17.5 17.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.
